trans-unit.source: .NET Primer
trans-unit.target: .NET Primer

trans-unit.source: By Rich Lander, Zlatko Knezevic
trans-unit.target: By Rich Lander, Zlatko Knezevic

trans-unit.source: .NET is a general purpose development platform.
trans-unit.target: .NET is a general purpose development platform.

trans-unit.source: It can be used for any kind of app type or workload where general purpose solutions are used.
trans-unit.target: It can be used for any kind of app type or workload where general purpose solutions are used.

trans-unit.source: It has several key features that are attractive to many developers, including automatic memory management and modern programming languages, that make it easier to efficiently build high-quality apps.
trans-unit.target: It has several key features that are attractive to many developers, including automatic memory management and modern programming languages, that make it easier to efficiently build high-quality apps.

trans-unit.source: .NET enables a high-level programming environment with many convenience features, while providing low-level access to native memory and APIs.
trans-unit.target: .NET enables a high-level programming environment with many convenience features, while providing low-level access to native memory and APIs.

trans-unit.source: Multiple implementations of .NET are available, based on open <linkText>.NET Standards</linkText><title></title> that specify the fundamentals of the platform.
trans-unit.target: Multiple implementations of .NET are available, based on open <linkText>.NET Standards</linkText><title></title> that specify the fundamentals of the platform.

trans-unit.source: They are separately optimized for different app types (e.g. desktop, mobile, gaming, cloud) and support many chips (e.g. x86/x64, ARM) and operating systems (e.g. Windows, Linux, iOS, Android, OS X).
trans-unit.target: They are separately optimized for different app types (e.g. desktop, mobile, gaming, cloud) and support many chips (e.g. x86/x64, ARM) and operating systems (e.g. Windows, Linux, iOS, Android, OS X).

trans-unit.source: Open source is also an important part of the .NET ecosystem, with multiple .NET implementations and many libraries available under OSI-approved licenses.
trans-unit.target: Open source is also an important part of the .NET ecosystem, with multiple .NET implementations and many libraries available under OSI-approved licenses.

trans-unit.source: You can take a look at the ../getting-started/overview document to figure out all of the different editions of .NET Framework that are available, both Microsoft's and others.
trans-unit.target: You can take a look at the ../getting-started/overview document to figure out all of the different editions of .NET Framework that are available, both Microsoft's and others.

trans-unit.source: Key .NET Concepts
trans-unit.target: Key .NET Concepts

trans-unit.source: There is a certain number of concepts that are very important to understand if you are new to the .NET Platform.
trans-unit.target: There is a certain number of concepts that are very important to understand if you are new to the .NET Platform.

trans-unit.source: These concepts are the cornerstone of the entire platform, and understanding them at the outset is important for general understanding of how .NET works.
trans-unit.target: These concepts are the cornerstone of the entire platform, and understanding them at the outset is important for general understanding of how .NET works.

trans-unit.source: A stroll through .NET
trans-unit.target: A stroll through .NET

trans-unit.source: As any mature and advanced application development framework, .NET has many powerful features that make the developer's job easier and aim to make writing code more powerful and expressive.
trans-unit.target: As any mature and advanced application development framework, .NET has many powerful features that make the developer's job easier and aim to make writing code more powerful and expressive.

trans-unit.source: This section will outline the basics of the most salient features and provide pointers to more detailed discussions where needed.
trans-unit.target: This section will outline the basics of the most salient features and provide pointers to more detailed discussions where needed.

trans-unit.source: After finishing this stroll, you should have enough information to be able to read the samples on our GitHub repos as well as other code and understand what is going on.
trans-unit.target: After finishing this stroll, you should have enough information to be able to read the samples on our GitHub repos as well as other code and understand what is going on.

trans-unit.source: Native interoperability

trans-unit.source: Automatic memory management
trans-unit.target: Automatic memory management

trans-unit.source: Garbage collection is the most well-known of .NET features.
trans-unit.target: Garbage collection is the most well-known of .NET features.

trans-unit.source: Developers do not need to actively manage memory, although there are affordances to provide more information to the garbage collector (GC).
trans-unit.target: Developers do not need to actively manage memory, although there are affordances to provide more information to the garbage collector (GC).

trans-unit.source: C\# includes the new keyword to allocate memory in terms of a particular type, and the using keyword to provide scope for the usage of the object.
trans-unit.target: C\# includes the new keyword to allocate memory in terms of a particular type, and the using keyword to provide scope for the usage of the object.

trans-unit.source: The GC operates on a lazy approach to memory management, preferring application throughput to the immediate collection of memory.
trans-unit.target: The GC operates on a lazy approach to memory management, preferring application throughput to the immediate collection of memory.

trans-unit.source: The following two lines both allocate memory:
trans-unit.target: The following two lines both allocate memory:

trans-unit.source: There is no analogous keyword to de-allocate memory, as de-allocation happens automatically when the garbage collector reclaims the memory through its scheduled running.
trans-unit.target: There is no analogous keyword to de-allocate memory, as de-allocation happens automatically when the garbage collector reclaims the memory through its scheduled running.

trans-unit.source: Method variables normally go out of scope once a method completes, at which point they can be collected.
trans-unit.target: Method variables normally go out of scope once a method completes, at which point they can be collected.

trans-unit.source: However, you can indicate to the GC that a particular object is out of scope sooner than method exit using the using statement.
trans-unit.target: However, you can indicate to the GC that a particular object is out of scope sooner than method exit using the using statement.

trans-unit.source: Once the using block completes, the GC will know that the stream object in the example above is free to be collected and its memory reclaimed.
trans-unit.target: Once the using block completes, the GC will know that the stream object in the example above is free to be collected and its memory reclaimed.

trans-unit.source: One of the less obvious but quite far-reaching features that a garbage collector enables is memory safety.
trans-unit.target: One of the less obvious but quite far-reaching features that a garbage collector enables is memory safety.

trans-unit.source: The invariant of memory safety is very simple: a program is memory safe if it accesses only memory that has been allocated (and not freed).
trans-unit.target: The invariant of memory safety is very simple: a program is memory safe if it accesses only memory that has been allocated (and not freed).

trans-unit.source: Dangling pointers are always bugs, and tracking them down is often quite difficult.
trans-unit.target: Dangling pointers are always bugs, and tracking them down is often quite difficult.

trans-unit.source: The .NET runtime provides additional services, to complete the promise of memory safety, not naturally offered by a GC.
trans-unit.target: The .NET runtime provides additional services, to complete the promise of memory safety, not naturally offered by a GC.

trans-unit.source: It ensures that programs do not index off the end of an array or accessing a phantom field off the end of an object.
trans-unit.target: It ensures that programs do not index off the end of an array or accessing a phantom field off the end of an object.

trans-unit.source: The following example will throw as a result of memory safety.
trans-unit.target: The following example will throw as a result of memory safety.

trans-unit.source: Type Safety
trans-unit.target: Type Safety

trans-unit.source: Objects are allocated in terms of types.
trans-unit.target: Objects are allocated in terms of types.

trans-unit.source: The only operations allowed for a given object, and the memory it consumes, are those of its type.
trans-unit.target: The only operations allowed for a given object, and the memory it consumes, are those of its type.

trans-unit.source: A Dog type may have Jump and WagTail methods, but not likely a SumTotal method.
trans-unit.target: A Dog type may have Jump and WagTail methods, but not likely a SumTotal method.

trans-unit.source: A program can only call the declared methods of a given type.
trans-unit.target: A program can only call the declared methods of a given type.

trans-unit.source: All other calls will result either in a compile-time error or a run-time exception (in case of using dynamic features or object).
trans-unit.target: All other calls will result either in a compile-time error or a run-time exception (in case of using dynamic features or object).

trans-unit.source: .NET languages can be object-oriented, with hierarchies of base and derived classes.
trans-unit.target: .NET languages can be object-oriented, with hierarchies of base and derived classes.

trans-unit.source: The .NET runtime will only allow object casts and calls that align with the object hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: The .NET runtime will only allow object casts and calls that align with the object hierarchy.

trans-unit.source: Remember that every type defined in any .NET language derives from the core object type.
trans-unit.target: Remember that every type defined in any .NET language derives from the core object type.

trans-unit.source: Type safety is also used to help enforce encapsulation by guaranteeing the fidelity of the accessor keywords.
trans-unit.target: Type safety is also used to help enforce encapsulation by guaranteeing the fidelity of the accessor keywords.

trans-unit.source: Accessor keywords are artifacts which control access to members of a given type by other code.
trans-unit.target: Accessor keywords are artifacts which control access to members of a given type by other code.

trans-unit.source: These are usually used for various kinds of data within a type that are used to manage its behavior.
trans-unit.target: These are usually used for various kinds of data within a type that are used to manage its behavior.

trans-unit.source: Some .NET languages support type inference.
trans-unit.target: Some .NET languages support type inference.

trans-unit.source: Type inference means that the compiler will deduce the type of the expression on the left-hand side from the expression on the right-hand side.
trans-unit.target: Type inference means that the compiler will deduce the type of the expression on the left-hand side from the expression on the right-hand side.

trans-unit.source: This doesn't mean that the type safety is broken or avoided.
trans-unit.target: This doesn't mean that the type safety is broken or avoided.

trans-unit.source: The resulting type has a strong type with everything that implies.
trans-unit.target: The resulting type has a strong type with everything that implies.

trans-unit.source: Let's rewrite the first two lines of the previous example to introduce type inference.
trans-unit.target: Let's rewrite the first two lines of the previous example to introduce type inference.

trans-unit.source: You will note that the rest of the example is completely the same.
trans-unit.target: You will note that the rest of the example is completely the same.

trans-unit.source: Delegates and Lambdas
trans-unit.target: Delegates and Lambdas

trans-unit.source: Delegates are like C++ function pointers, with a big difference that they are type safe.
trans-unit.target: Delegates are like C++ function pointers, with a big difference that they are type safe.

trans-unit.source: They are a kind of disconnected method within the CLR type system.
trans-unit.target: They are a kind of disconnected method within the CLR type system.

trans-unit.source: Regular methods are attached to a class and only directly callable through static or instance calling conventions.
trans-unit.target: Regular methods are attached to a class and only directly callable through static or instance calling conventions.

trans-unit.source: Delegates are used in various APIs and places in the .NET world, especially through lambda expressions, which are a cornerstone of Linq.
trans-unit.target: Delegates are used in various APIs and places in the .NET world, especially through lambda expressions, which are a cornerstone of Linq.

trans-unit.source: Read more about it in the delegates-lambdas document.
trans-unit.target: Read more about it in the delegates-lambdas document.

trans-unit.source: Generic Types (Generics)
trans-unit.target: Generic Types (Generics)

trans-unit.source: Generic types, a.k.a "generics" are a feature that was added in .NET Framework 2.0.
trans-unit.target: Generic types, a.k.a "generics" are a feature that was added in .NET Framework 2.0.

trans-unit.source: In short, generics allow the programmer to introduce a "type parameter" when designing their classes, that will allow the client code (i.e. the users of the type) to specify the exact type to use in place of the type parameter.
trans-unit.target: In short, generics allow the programmer to introduce a "type parameter" when designing their classes, that will allow the client code (i.e. the users of the type) to specify the exact type to use in place of the type parameter.

trans-unit.source: Generics were added in order to help programmers implement generic data structures.
trans-unit.target: Generics were added in order to help programmers implement generic data structures.

trans-unit.source: Before their arrival, in order for a, say, List type to be generic, it would have to work with elements that were of type object.
trans-unit.target: Before their arrival, in order for a, say, List type to be generic, it would have to work with elements that were of type object.

trans-unit.source: This would have various performance as well as semantic problems, not to mention possible subtle runtime errors.
trans-unit.target: This would have various performance as well as semantic problems, not to mention possible subtle runtime errors.

trans-unit.source: The most notorious of the latter is when a data structure contains, for instance, both integers and strings, and an InvalidCastException is thrown on working with the list's members.
trans-unit.target: The most notorious of the latter is when a data structure contains, for instance, both integers and strings, and an InvalidCastException is thrown on working with the list's members.

trans-unit.source: The below sample shows a basic program running using an instance of List<T> types.
trans-unit.target: The below sample shows a basic program running using an instance of List<T> types.

trans-unit.source: Read more about it in the generics document.
trans-unit.target: Read more about it in the generics document.

trans-unit.source: Async Programming
trans-unit.target: Async Programming

trans-unit.source: Async is a first-class concept within .NET, with async support in the runtime, the framework libraries and various .NET languages.
trans-unit.target: Async is a first-class concept within .NET, with async support in the runtime, the framework libraries and various .NET languages.

trans-unit.source: Async is based off of the Task concept, which encapsulates a set of operations to be completed.
trans-unit.target: Async is based off of the Task concept, which encapsulates a set of operations to be completed.

trans-unit.source: Tasks are distinct from threads and may not rely on threads or require CPU time much at all, particularly for I/O-bound tasks.
trans-unit.target: Tasks are distinct from threads and may not rely on threads or require CPU time much at all, particularly for I/O-bound tasks.

trans-unit.source: TODO: Elaborate on Task concept.
trans-unit.target: TODO: Elaborate on Task concept.

trans-unit.source: C\# includes special treatment for async, including the special keyword await for managing tasks.
trans-unit.target: C\# includes special treatment for async, including the special keyword await for managing tasks.

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates calling a web endpoint as an async operation.
trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates calling a web endpoint as an async operation.

trans-unit.source: The call to client.GetStringAsync(url) does not block, but instead immediately yields by returning a Task.
trans-unit.target: The call to client.GetStringAsync(url) does not block, but instead immediately yields by returning a Task.

trans-unit.source: Computation resumes and the call returns the requested string when the network activity has completed.
trans-unit.target: Computation resumes and the call returns the requested string when the network activity has completed.

trans-unit.source: Language Integrated Query (LINQ)
trans-unit.target: Language Integrated Query (LINQ)

trans-unit.source: .NET programs typically operate on some form of data.
trans-unit.target: .NET programs typically operate on some form of data.

trans-unit.source: The data can be database-resident or in the form of objects (sometimes called POCOs for "Plain Old CLR Objects").
trans-unit.target: The data can be database-resident or in the form of objects (sometimes called POCOs for "Plain Old CLR Objects").

trans-unit.source: LINQ provides a language-integrated uniform query model over data, independent of the source.
trans-unit.target: LINQ provides a language-integrated uniform query model over data, independent of the source.

trans-unit.source: Linq providers bridge the gap between the uniform query model and the form of the data, such as SQL Server tables, XML documents, standard collections like List and more.
trans-unit.target: Linq providers bridge the gap between the uniform query model and the form of the data, such as SQL Server tables, XML documents, standard collections like List and more.

trans-unit.source: The follow examples demonstrate various uses of LINQ to query different forms of data.
trans-unit.target: The follow examples demonstrate various uses of LINQ to query different forms of data.

trans-unit.target: TODO: finish the section, link to a more detailed document.

trans-unit.source: Native Interoperability
trans-unit.target: Native Interoperability

trans-unit.source: .NET provides low-level access to native APIs via the platform invoke or P/Invoke facility.
trans-unit.target: .NET provides low-level access to native APIs via the platform invoke or P/Invoke facility.

trans-unit.source: It enables a mapping of .NET types to native types, which the .NET runtime marshalls before calling the native API.
trans-unit.target: It enables a mapping of .NET types to native types, which the .NET runtime marshalls before calling the native API.

trans-unit.source: TODO: Examples.
trans-unit.target: TODO: Examples.

trans-unit.source: Higher-level native interop can be established with P/Invoke.
trans-unit.target: Higher-level native interop can be established with P/Invoke.

trans-unit.source: The COM and WinRT interop systems in the CLR are both built on top of P/Invoke.
trans-unit.target: The COM and WinRT interop systems in the CLR are both built on top of P/Invoke.

trans-unit.source: The Java and Objective-C interop systems provided by Xamarin on top of Mono are fundamentally the same.
trans-unit.target: The Java and Objective-C interop systems provided by Xamarin on top of Mono are fundamentally the same.

trans-unit.source: Unsafe Code
trans-unit.target: Unsafe Code

trans-unit.source: The CLR enables the ability to acccess native memory and do pointer arithmetic.
trans-unit.target: The CLR enables the ability to acccess native memory and do pointer arithmetic.

trans-unit.source: These operations are needed for some algortithms and for calling some native APIs.
trans-unit.target: These operations are needed for some algortithms and for calling some native APIs.

trans-unit.source: The use of these capabilities is discouraged, since you no longer get the benefit of verifiability, nor will your code be allowed to run in all environments.
trans-unit.target: The use of these capabilities is discouraged, since you no longer get the benefit of verifiability, nor will your code be allowed to run in all environments.

trans-unit.source: The best practice is to confine unsafe code as much as possible and that the vast majority of code is type-safe.
trans-unit.target: The best practice is to confine unsafe code as much as possible and that the vast majority of code is type-safe.

trans-unit.source: TODO: Examples.
trans-unit.target: TODO: Examples.

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: Notes

trans-unit.source: The term ".NET runtime" is used throughout the document to accomodate for the multiple implementations of .NET, such as CLR, Mono, IL2CPP and others.
trans-unit.target: The term ".NET runtime" is used throughout the document to accomodate for the multiple implementations of .NET, such as CLR, Mono, IL2CPP and others.

trans-unit.source: The more specific names are only used if needed.
trans-unit.target: The more specific names are only used if needed.

trans-unit.source: This document is not intended to be historical in nature, but describe the .NET platform as it is now.
trans-unit.target: This document is not intended to be historical in nature, but describe the .NET platform as it is now.

trans-unit.source: It isn't important whether a .NET feature has always been available or was only recently introduced, only that it is important enough to highlight and discuss.
trans-unit.target: It isn't important whether a .NET feature has always been available or was only recently introduced, only that it is important enough to highlight and discuss.
